course.subject: OCES
course.name: The Earth as a Blue Planet
course.description: The ocean is the largest life supporting habitat on Earth, and yet, it is less explored than the surface of the moon. This survey course introduces students to the fundamental, cross-disciplinary knowledge of our ocean from its formation, to the physics in circulation and climate modulation, to the chemistry and biology of the living systems within.

reviews.author: KellyIfntlll
reviews.title: Great course instead
reviews.comment_content: Content is good, you can really learn something after this course. If you are somehow interested in ocean science, I strongly recommend this course for you. You will learn like how is the water flow in ocean, biodiversity in the ocean, human activities' effect on the ocean, etc. And if you have taken biology in DSE, you are slightly advantaged as 1 out of 7 topics in this course you have already learned in your biology class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is good, as each topic is taught by different professor, each professor is really familiar with the area that he will be teaching in class.

The overall process of the course is like this:
Every week, you watched the video at home, then complete the online quiz, next, go to class to complete the case study. In class, the instructor and TA will be there, and the professor responsible for this week's topic will also be there for you to ask questions and give instructions for you to complete the case study. Then next week, another video will be posted and another professor will be in class to talk about the another case study.

This course only have one meeting per week as the another class is organized as online learning mode. You have to watch one video(about 2 hour) per week. You learn while watching the video, then go to class and complete the case study during class time. The video is really clear and easy to understand, so there is no difficulty in learning though the video. Just make sure you really do watch them.(actually you can watch them in 1.5x speed)

However, the instructor (Ice Ko) is so annoying. She acts like your high school discipline master and teaches you how to behave in class..... other than her annoyance, other things are really good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good.
I score full mark in all quizzes while the mean for the quizzes are about 8 to 9 out of 10 marks.
Case studies marks are unknown.
Final exam I scored 43/50, the mean is 38.5
Finally I get A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload instead.

7 quizzes in total, one to complete every week after you watched the video for the week. Each quiz have 10 questions and they are super easy questions that you will definitely get full mark if you watched the video.

7 Case studies in total. One to complete every lecture. There will be random grouping each lecture, you have to check the grouping everytime before lecture time. each group will have 4 members to complete the case study together. Then the grouping will change for the next lecture. The case study is also quiet easy.

And one final exam

Weighting:
35% 7 Quiz (5%each)
35% 7 Case study (5%each)
30% 1 Final exam
*Attendance is not taken but you must attend every class because one case study is conducted in every lecture, if you are absent, you will score 0 in that case study, which means you lose 5% in all total grade.

reviews.author: gonpachirou
reviews.title: Good grade course, but delivery can be improved.
reviews.comment_content:
1. Case studies (in-class)
a. 35%
b. Complete case study worksheets through group discussions within class times
2. Concept map exercise
a. 10%
b. Group work - to be conducted outside class time
c. Students need to coordinate this group work by themselves (i.e. done outside class time). Each group should submit one concept map that shows their interpretation of connecting Modules (1), (3a), and any two other module parts (2a, 2b, 3c, or 4) to the theme 'Ocean Circulation, Biodiversity and Humans'. More information will be given in the class on 22nd Feb
d. Concept Map submission due Tue 10th May
e. Use https://miro.com/ app to make the concept map
3. Peer rating (online, using iPeer)
a. 5%
b. Individual work - each student needs to evaluate his/her group members' performance in items 1 and 2 above
c. Intra group peer evaluation for group assignments
i. Case studies
ii. Concept map exercise
d. The peer rating aims to provide a chance for students to evaluate each other's contribution in the group work. Up to 5% from this category will be deducted for free-riders. More information will be given in the class on 15th Mar.
e. Peer rating submission due Tue 10th May
4. Final examination
a. 50%
b. Based on online lectures (videos & power points) and online quizzes (the self-tests)
Multiple-choice, open-book, but time limit short. Answers will be based on teaching materials; answers on internet will differ in perspective.

7 modules which were moderately interesting but teaching quality and TA response was sub-par, definitely.
reviews.comment_teaching:
"Blended learning course" so ALL lectures are delivered in the form of online videos that were recorded ~6 years ago.

Class time is used to complete case study worksheets with groupmates selected randomly in the beginning of the semester.

Most people do not watch the lecture videos instead opting to read the powerpoint slides directly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very unclear, case study grades are not released causing (personally) anxiety. Concept map grading is also very subjective and rubric does not really give you an idea of what the final project should look like.

However, the A-range percentage is quite reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload as long as you have non-freerider teammates.
Final revision is pretty challenging, though.

reviews.author: rchtse
reviews.title: an introductory course to ocean science
reviews.comment_content:
This course adopts Blended Learning mode, which we only have to attend 1 face-to-face session each week and we have to watch another lecture that is pre-recorded in canvas.

There are 4 modules, each with sub-sessions.
1. Physical characteristics of the ocean
2a.Diversity of Marine Life
2b.Interactions among Marine Organisms - How do they obtain food?
3a. Coastal Processes
3b. The Subtidal, Intertidal, and Estuaries
3c. The deep sea
4. Humans and the sea

Don't expect this course to have in-depth discussion in those topics, this is just the introductory course to the ocean science and thus provide a broad ideas to several topics, so remember to answer the quiz solely based on the knowledge from online lecture and ppt. I remembered I chose a 'wrong' answer based on my prior knowledge of the topics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko is just the coordinator of the course, she didn't teach the contents of the course. And the other 7 instructors taught 1 session according to their expertise

The precious thing about this course is that there is no textbook, therefore sometimes the professor will use their research findings as teaching materials. This may be an exciting thing for those who want to be part of research in ocean sci.

The professors are pretty good in general, but most of them have mainland accents.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade:
35% case study (7 case studies, 5% each)
35% online quizzes (7 quizzes, 5% each)
30% final exam

My grade:
case study: unknown
online quizzes: 65/70 (mean 61.1/70)
final exam: 43/50 (mean 38.5)
final grade: A-

Since everything is so easy, you have to be very cautious to get in A range. I guess you have to get near 90 marks for an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload.
You just have to watch the video every week and complete the online quizzes, which are easy and very direct, you will have a few days to complete that.
And be prepared with the face-to-face session, which you have around 30mins to complete a worksheet in the assigned group (the time is limited so you really have to rush for every Q). And  the groups will be changed for each modules  But be prepared that you will face some irresponsible groupmates that don't watch the video and don't contribute anything in group discussion, so you really have to understand everything said in the video lecture.

reviews.author: James:)
reviews.title: Highly suggested for senior-year students, especially science students, who wish to fulfil the requirement for free credits.
reviews.comment_content:
Module (1): Physical Characteristics of the Ocean
Module (2a): A Glimpse of Marine Life â€“ Diversity of Life
Module (2b): A Glimpse of Marine Life â€“ How do They Obtain Food?
Module (3a): The Coastal, Intertidal and Subtidal
Module (3b): The Subtidal, The Intertidal, and Estuaries
Module (4): The Deep Sea
Module (5): Humans and the Sea

There is only one lecture per teaching week. The 80-minute lecture begins with a short briefing by the instructor, lasting around 20 minutes. The remaining 60 minutes are dedicated to case study discussions with your group mates.
reviews.comment_teaching: I did not pay attention to their teaching, so I cannot comment on that. However, it's important to remain respectful even if you are not listening.
reviews.comment_grading:
35%: Case Studies x7 (@5%)
7%: Online Quizzes x7 (@1%)
7%: Peer Rating
51%: Final Exam (All MCQs)

Final Grade: A+

Unexpectedly good! I received an A+ even though I missed a case study. However, they did not publish the scores for some of the case studies and the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little. I didn't go through any of the pre-class readings or online lectures at all, and still, I managed to achieve a decent grade. Throughout the course, all I did was take quizzes and study for the final exam. Reviewing the slides once should be more than enough to attain a grade of B-range.

For Canvas quizzes, correct answers will be shown when you click submit. You will have a total of 3 attempts. The final exam was quite straightforward, with no tricky questions at all. Just make sure to familiarize yourself with the quiz questions as they will be similar to those in the final exam.

reviews.author: ebcv
reviews.comment_content:
7 modules
physical characteristics of the ocean
a glimpse of marine life - diversity of life
a glimpse of marine life - how do they obtain food
the coastal, intertidal, subtidal (2)
the deep sea
humans and the sea

content is very interesting. doesn't go in depth.
reviews.comment_teaching: blended mode -- read the modules and take the quiz before each lecture (once a week). then prof will change each week and will teach for like 15 minutes. then rest of the time is just for answering the case study with groupmates. not much to say - the videos modules are easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
no midterm
7 case studies - 5% each = 35%
7 online quizzes - 1% each = 7%
peer rating - 7%
final exam - 51% all MC not difficult jus a lot of content to go through
reviews.comment_workload: each module takes around 1-2 hours to go through. quizzes are 10 questions but very easy and straightforward if you watched the videos. case studies are simple, find a good group.

reviews.author: LunaLys
reviews.comment_content:
I only give some remarkable contents

Some facts about the ocean and ecosystem, no math or physics, just chill.
There are 2 optional field trips, one to mai po and one to watch dolphins on a cruise in lantau island.
reviews.comment_teaching: no comment, just read the materials. The profs have something to say each lecture for about 30mins and they have q&a session
reviews.comment_grading:
only MC in final, the MCs are pretty straight- forward
every weeks got a lesson for group discussion and group worksheet. The worksheets are easy to complete, you can even do it individually.
reviews.comment_workload: videos, ppt and quizzes each 2-week, lesson each 2 weeks

reviews.author: Juliagsch
reviews.comment_content: Very interesting, covers many topics but doesn't go in a lot of depth.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructors change each lecture, all of them were good up until now. However there isn't a lot of instruction as most of the lecture time is used for the assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizes: 7%
In-class assignments: 35%
Attendance: 7%
Final Exam : 51%

Only received Quiz and assignments grades yet but they were very generous, you can even repeat the quiz 2 times if you don't score full marks on the first try.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of work, mainly just coming to class and reading some articles which aren't long.

reviews.author: Shin, Woo-hong
reviews.comment_content:
Content was very interesting. The general concept of biology, chemistry and physics were covered in this course. If you want to learn about the general Ocean Science, you can take this course for your interest.  
1.Physical Characteristics of the ocean
2.A Glimpse of marine life â€“ Diversity of Life
3. A Glimpse of marine lifeâ€“ how do they obtain food?
4.the coastal, Intertidal and Subtidal
5.The deep sea
6.Humans and the sea.
reviews.comment_teaching: Instructors explain their topics pretty well. I did not have any problem with understand those concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was not bad, I got b+ for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Group project and exams which are proper amounts.

reviews.author: C tong
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of geography, biology and some social science. Not difficult. Student with zero science base can also handle this course.
Module(1):Physical Characteristics of the Ocean
Module(2a):A Glimpse of Marine Lifeâ€“Diversity of Life
Module(2b):A Glimpse of Marine Lifeâ€“How do They Obtain Food?
Module(3a):The Coastal, Intertidal and Subtidal
Module(3b):The Coastal ,Intertidal and Subtidal
Module(3c):The Deep Sea
Module(4):Humans and the Sea
reviews.comment_teaching: It is a BLD course so you may need to watch the lecture videos out of class. Most of the professors are come from the mainland China so it is a little bit hard to listen. Most of the content have been included in the PPTs so it is better to set 2x speed otherwise it will be boring and time wasting. And please remember not to be late, Ice Ko is really harsh.
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal, not bad and not good.
We need to finish several worksheet during the class. No score will be given so I cannot tell you the score and statistics. The final also do not release the score, the map drawing project also.
Also contain parti, do not be a freerider or you will get zero mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
No big, you need to read the worksheet material and lecture videos before the class. Only one assignment which is a Concept Map concluding the whole module. You may be formed in a group of 4 randomly. If you have good groupmates, congratulations. Your workload will be low. If you have only one normal groupmate just like me, do not be nervous, it is also not a heavy work.
Finally, choose this course only if you really want to choose ocean science as major.

reviews.author: Tony_
reviews.title: QUIZZZZZZ å¥½é‡è¦ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼
reviews.comment_content:
All the curriculums are fun and easy to handle. You'd better do all the quizzes on time, otherwise, it will be locked before the exam. If you have studied biology in your secondary school, congratulation to you that you can handle it easily.  

There is a weekly online meeting in this course, you have to create a CONCEPT MAP with your teammates. : )

Please bear in mind, the quizzes have a due day (weekly), some of the questions are directly extracted from the quizzes.

You have to do a case study weekly.
reviews.comment_teaching:
BLENDED LEARNING course.

ICE KO's lessons are really wasting our time.
reviews.comment_grading:
ERH...
difficult to get A (for real)

ME: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
è¼•é¬†
æŠµè®€

reviews.author: zoie
reviews.comment_content:
there are mainly 4 modules
1: Physical Characteristics of the Ocean
2a: Glimpse of Marine Life
2b:  Glimpse of Marine Life and Interactions
3a:  Marine Ecosystems - Coastal Physical Processes
3b: Marine Ecosystems - Subtidal, Intertidal and Estuaries
3c: Marine Ecosystems The Deep Sea
4: Humans and the Sea
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is blend mode (maybe due to the pandemic)
Students have to watch the lecture videos outside the lecture and do the group project during the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good
The results of projects and final exam were not released
My grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
There is one group project per lesson (total: 7)
one concept map (group work)
no mid term
but have final exam

reviews.author: Vicky Yau
reviews.comment_content: a basic interesting course of ocean science, mentioned ocean circulation, marine animals, deep ocean habitats, etc. It's easy to get a good grade if u read through the learning material by yourselves before each lesson and do the worksheet in zoom discussion time seriously. Also, we need to make a concept map with groupmates, that need to be completed outside the class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Each chapter is taught by different professors, overall the teaching is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok, a quiz is given before each lesson but the mark is not counted as the final grade so I haven't done most of it. Also, u have to read the case study materials before group discussion, some have a lot of pages. At the end of the course, an A4 page concept needs to be made by each group.

reviews.author: Shmong
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture videos are the only content that you need to listen to
and every week you have to complete a case study worksheet and discussion with your groupmate (must submit them on time, ice ko will be angry haha)

Module 1: Physical Characteristics of the Ocean [Prof Yan WANG]
Module (2a) - A Glimpse of Marine Life: Diversity of Marine Life [Prof Qinglu ZENG]
Module 2(b) - A Glimpse of Marine Life: How do They Obtain Food? [Prof Stanley LAU]
Module 3(a) - Coastal Processes [Prof Jianping GAN]
Module (3b): The Intertidal, Subtidal and Estuaries [Prof Hongbin LIU]
Module (3c): The Deep Sea [Prof Peiyuan QIAN]
Module 4: Humans and the Sea [Prof Charmaine YUNG]

Some of the contents are just common sense while some need to use some brainpower!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the prof has an accent,
a bit boring,
easy to understand,
WHY ICE KO IS HERE???
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good! Study the ppt will be enough
Final: MC (all answers can be found in the ppt)
Final marks: unknown
Project(Concept Map): (8/10)
Quiz: 6/10 in average
Final Grade: A-
I think the majority of the class gets a decent grade!
reviews.comment_workload:
Above average
-Lecture videos are pretty long (just fast forward)
-Worksheets: base on the readings they give you and you have 1 week to study them (I skip them cuz you may find the answers in ppt or google)
-Project: sum up all the concepts form module 1 to 4 and construct a concept map in A4 size (take times to think what should be included) I met some good gpmates and we simply divided the work into 3 and complete the map. btw how can ice ko come up with this assignment OMG!

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to ocean science. Covers things like marine life diversity, coastal, inter-tidal and sub-tidal areas, marine ecosystems and human impact on the ocean. As an engineering student these were pretty boring, but not too hard to understand.

Syllabus as follows:
1. Physical characteristics of the ocean
2a.Diversity of Marine Life
2b.Interactions among Marine Organisms - How do they obtain food?
3a. Coastal Processes
3b. The Subtidal, Intertidal, and Estuaries
3c. The deep sea
4. Humans and the sea

All of these are quite easy to understand other than 3a, which was quite complex.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is done online by yourself, watch the lecture videos and do the online quiz (does not affect grade). You don't actually have to watch the videos since the professors repeat what is on the powerpoints anyway.

Every video has a different professor and the teaching was pretty good, the mainland professors had quite a heavy accent, luckily there are subtitles for every video, so it is not a problem. You only attend classes once a week to do the case studies, after the professor introduces themselves and their field of work a bit more.

Ice Ko is the coordinator for the course, and despite not teaching, somehow is able to negatively impact my enjoyment of the course, as she keeps repeating the SIMPLEST of things and refuses to listen to the class.

Seeing a fellow frustrated student trying to explain why she was unable to do the quiz because Ice messed the quiz up by changing the submission time WHILE everyone was doing the quiz and only to have her repeat on HOW to use CANVAS was gave me flashbacks to kindergarten. Also refuses to shut up while everyone is doing their exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% Case Studies
Case study every week, 7 in total, 1 for each chapter. You really have to scramble to finish them, and hope god gave you good groupmates or otherwise you would have to try to finish all of them yourself, unfortunately I was not very lucky and did not have the best of group mates. Also pray to god that the professor would randomly visit your group and give you "hints", (pretty much the actual answer) or otherwise you would not get the highest of marks.

10% Concept Map
Despite only being 10%, this is quite difficult. Again you would need to work with your groupmates (luck required) and need to make a map connecting ALL ideas taught in the course, it sounds difficult, and is actually even more difficult in reality, we spent a LOT of time doing this.

5% Peer Evaluation
Give feedback around your groupmates, finish the evaluation for 5%.

50% Final Exam
Online finals, due to the coronavirus. Open book and only MC questions. Time allowed is very short however so you really have to study and hurry. I spent quite some time studying and still could only BARELY finish the exam. Some questions also seemed out of syllabus? Or at least were super niche, I couldn't find the answers from the powerpoints (Which you should convert to .pdf by the way).

In the end I got an A-, with nothing shown on CANVAS other than my concept map, which was a 8/10. It seems my struggle in making the concept map really helped me in the finals. However because such a HUGE part of the course can be affected by your groupmates, you may not want to consider this course if you are not a lucky one, take it if you are feeling brave.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is OK, other than the group projects it is pretty light. Go through the chapter materials before the case study, and studying for 2-3 days before the final is enough.

In the end it depends on what kind of groupmates you get, because of my groupmates I spend a lot of time reading the powerpoints and fixing the concept map for them, and it somewhat helped in my finals I guess...

reviews.author: ä¸­æ–‡æ”Uå…¥U
reviews.title: Overall good,but Ice Ko is too strict.
reviews.comment_content:
This is a blended learning course.The content is quite good indeed.Each sub module works like 1 online class+1 in class discussion.Each sub module invites different prof of the department to talk about their expert areas.
In class discussion grouping changing by every module,you gotta meet alot of year one science students,which is kinda good policy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most of the professor deliver high quality content,and speaks hear-able English.Unfortunately,the chair professor's English is to be improved.
Ice Ko,the coordinator of the course is far too strict.She acts like a kindergarten/primary teacher,always scolding people with tiny little things.Like talking loudly for ONE second, or looking at your phone for a sec(regardless you are looking at course notes)Strict Punctuality.Just fair too strict,and blamed by classmates I know.
reviews.comment_grading:
Got average 8.9/10 in 7 quizzes(35%)
Quizzes are straight forward and have unlimited attempts
37/50 in online final(30%)
Little bit tricky
Case Study score never revealed.
Got a B at last.(35%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was okay
Workload=online lesson(1.5-2.5hrs per lesson) +preparation for in class discussion+do the quiz(unlimited attempts)
Just 7 lessons in the whole semester,and quizzes are straight forward
You may read some additional reading materials chosen by prof..
btw inclass discussion=attendance

reviews.author: Jerryyy
reviews.title: If you're interested in biology / ocean science, you can obtain leng grade without prior knowledge!
reviews.comment_content:
Check this!
http://oces-e2.uat01.ust.hk/sites/oces-e2.uat01.ust.hk/files/OCES%201001%20syllabus.pdf

Key:
1. NO midterm
2. Final exam counts towards 51% of the course
3. 7 case studies to be handed in (5% for each one)
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair. You would definitely learn something from this course. Professors are nice and they even provided us an experience to visit the OCES centre in HKUST before case studies, and go on a site visit near Hoi Ha Wan to explore the nature and sea habitats.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade: A-range
As a first-year engineering student without any prior knowledge related to biology, I believe it is truly a leng grade course. I really recommend you to reg this and study hard as you can obviously get a satisfied grade at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, all you have to do is to find some great + competent group mates for your weekly case studies! All the lectures are video-based so you need to be self-disciplined. Only 51 multiple choices in final exam and each one counts 1% towards your course grading, so...  be careful but it is not hard at all.

reviews.author: kapbunca
reviews.title: Decent course
reviews.comment_content:
Module (1): Physical Characteristics of the Ocean
Module (2a): A Glimpse of Marine Life â€“ Diversity of Life
Module (2b):  A Glimpse of Marine Life â€“ How do They Obtain Food?
Module (3a): The Coastal, Intertidal and Subtidal
Module (3c): The Deep Sea
Module (4): Humans and the Sea

The topics are quite interesting, module 3c & 4 are more common sense based so the content isn't really that difficult
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tbh we didn't have much interactions with the professors since it is a blended mode, you simply just watch the videos at home then attend the course on zoom.

Let's not forget about Ice Ko, ok i don't wanna be rude, but I feel like she treats us like we're still in primary school lmao. I know she's trying to be friendly but with the way she treats us I guess some people might find her really annoying. Luckily, she's just a coordinator not a professor so don't worry!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Basically
- in class case studies (35%)
- final concept map (10%)
- final exam (50%)- all mcs
- peer rating (5%)
attendance is needed
but they never released the marks tho

Got a B+, which is decent imo
reviews.comment_workload:
so basically there's a few things to do each week:
watch videos + complete module quiz (unlimited entries, easy full mark)+ study the reading materials -> attend the course for in class case studies

The case studies are around 35 minutes with 6-7 questions and it is done in groups of 3/4. FYI they'll do the grouping for you so if you reg with your friends, you guys would probably be separated. All you could do is pray that your group mates are not free-riders. Luckily, my groupmates are really nice, so I don't see doing case studies as a challenging work. Time is pretty tight, so you gotta do it together asap.

Final concept map: (submit before final exam)
your group has choose 2-3 modules and basically make a huge concept map connecting all the chosen topics. Not difficult as long as you have studied the topics.

Exam:
1hr30mins, all mc open book exam (sorry i forgot the number of questions)
a very rushed exam as i remembered, i think i missed out a few questions. So open book or not doesn't really matter, you wouldn't have sufficient time to go through your notes.

Is the workload high? maybe, for some people. Since there's quite a lot to do and prep in zoom mode, but i actually enjoyed the course more than I thought (probably because i got good groupmates) good luck!!!

reviews.author: Metanoia
reviews.comment_content: Good, interesting content.
